item.title: 2. Array/List
item.description:
Arrays, more commonly known as lists in Python, are one of the most fundamental and widely used data structures. They store items in a sequential, ordered manner, and support a wide range of operations efficiently.

This post is designed as a refresher for interviews or technical review, with code examples, time complexity analysis, and clarifications on memory behavior.

1. What is an Array (List)?

In Python, the built-in list type is a dynamic array implementation. Arrays:

item.title: 1. Big O asymptotic analysis
item.description:
1. What is good code?

  • Readability : How easily humans can understand, modify, and maintain a piece of code.
  • Scalability: How well the code can handle increased load and complexity.

Big O, a shorthand for Big O asymptotic analysis, measures the scalability of code. Scalability consists of runtime and memory. There is usally a trade-off between runtime and memory. In this post, we introduce the Big O notation in terms of runtime and look at how to measure the space complexity of an algorithm at the end.
